reviewText: My son loves this dvd and could watch it over and over. I wish they'd reprise this great, classic show!
summary: My toddler loves Zoboomafoo. Too bad there aren't new episodes. :-(
Title: Zoboomafoo: With The Kratt Brothers

reviewText: My kids are only two and four years old, so Zoboomafoo had been off the air for a while before they were born.  We stumbled onto the videos when we got a promotional one from the National Wildlife Federation about a year ago.  My older daughter loved it and watched it over and over and over in the car (thank heavens for headphones!).  It's rather hard to find Zoboomafoo on video, so I was thrilled to find this collection of six episodes (the NWF videos only have three episodes each).  One video is long enough to cover a fairly long car trip without having to restart several times.As for the episodes themselves, they're great.  Chris and Martin are clearly knowledgeable about and comfortable with all kinds of different animals and they have a way with explaining about the animals without making it just another "boring" nature video.  They spend the majority of each show at Animal Junction with the engaging, if rather goofy, leaping lemur, Zoboomafoo ("Zoboo"), who only talks after he's eaten (and burped, much to the delight of your average preschooler).  They cover several different animals who happen to arrive at Animal Junction.  The animals are usually quite different from each other and come from different classes/phyla, but they all share a unifying characteristic (such as "slimy creatures").  Then after a while Chris and Martin will go to the "closet" to grab their stuff for an adventure in the wild (after all the stuff in the closet falls on them first, of course).  Their adventures take them a number of places ranging from the American southwest to the safari lands of Africa.Chris and Martin have a vary laid-back, easy-going, humorous style that keeps kids (and even adults) laughing and engaged.  They often play jokes and tricks on each other, they're not afraid to get down and dirty, and Zaboo is always ready with another corny joke (or a somewhat bizarre story from "Zobooland").  But it's not all fun and games.  My older daughter is always surprising me with how much she knows about animals and nine times out of ten she's learned it from Chris and Martin.  This particular video contains the following episodes:  "Fling," "Slimy Buddies" (my daughters' favorite), "Fast and Slow", "Giants", "Bears" and "Eye Spy".Zoboomafoo is appropriate for the toddler through kindergartener set.  While Chris and Martin strive to be accurate and informative about animal life, they stop short of some of the most natural animal behaviors such as mating.  Also, they discuss aspects of hunting behavior in predatory animals, but they stop short of showing any animal killing or eating any other animal.  If you feel your child is ready for this kind of information, Chris and Martin have also done a series for older kids called "Be the Creature".If you haven't already met the Kratt brothers, the Zoboomafoo series is a great introduction to their dedicated and sensitive work with animals.  Your child will love the humor and antics of Zoboo and the Kratt brothers, and Chris and Martin themselves are easy enough on the eyes that Mama might not mind watching an episode or two (or six) herself.  I sure don't.
Title: Zoboomafoo: With The Kratt Brothers

reviewText: Any fans of the Zoboomafoo TV shows or the"Wild Kratts" will enjoy this DVD  over and over.  My grandchildren are 2- and 5-years old.  They never get enough of these shows.
Title: Zoboomafoo: With The Kratt Brothers

reviewText: My kids love Zoboomafoo. When sprout took it off the air I had to get the DVD. So glad that I did.
Title: Zoboomafoo: With The Kratt Brothers

reviewText: This show was on TV a long while ago and I remembered it from my babysitting days. My son loves the new show Wild Kratts so I bought this for him and he loves this show too. It is an active show that keeps your childs attention without conflict and loss stories. There is great learning potential for kids interested in animals or if not they may be after watching this show. The Kratt brothers know how to talk with kids and keep their interest. This video is worth it for kids ages 3-7 I would guess.
Title: Zoboomafoo: With The Kratt Brothers

reviewText: My little guy loves zooboomafoo and this plays for 120min.  so he is entertained and happy for almost two hours.
Title: Zoboomafoo: With The Kratt Brothers

reviewText: Some of my kids got to enjoy this when it ran on TV, the rest are getting it this way.  I don't think it matters which of the series the Kratt brothers made, they are all great fun, great entertainment, and great for kids of any age.  We're watching the latest one on PBS now, and stocking up on the 'old' series besides.  Kids just love these nature programs, presented as they are in such a fun way they connect with so much more easily (though I bet they would have enjoyed Mutual of Omaha's Wild Kingdom, too, seeing as that was all that was available back then!)  Great job, guys--are you planning another series already?
Title: Zoboomafoo: With The Kratt Brothers

reviewText: I purchased this for my daughter and she loves it. Sees watches this show on Sprout TV and I looked in other stores and no one had it. Sure enough Amazon had it. I will be ordering another one soon for my niece. Delivery was excellent as always.
Title: Zoboomafoo: With The Kratt Brothers

reviewText: I first saw Zaboomafoo 10 years ago when my grandaughter was young.  I wanted my 5 year old grandson to see this show because it is so much fun.  The Kratt brothers are great and Zaboomafoo, a talking lemur, looks so real.  They all have so much fun with the animals they bring into the club house while teaching children about them.  I would recommend this dvd and this show to anyone with young children.
Title: Zoboomafoo: With The Kratt Brothers
